title: WATERISK pipeline parameters
description: Assemble bacterial genome from Nanopore to detect AMR and MGE association

long_reads_dir.description: The absolute path of the input directory that contains long_read fastq

index_file.description: The absolute path of the index file that contains estimated chomosome length for each isolate. If set to null, it will be estimated automatically and long read assembly will be performed.

trim_end_size.description: Number of bases to remove at each end of the read

quality_trim.description: Parameter can be used to trim low-quality ends from reads.

amr_db.description: AMR database for AMR detection with ABRICATE

remove_barcode.description: If true, remove barcodes with Porechop

medaka.description: if true, polish the long read assembly with Medaka

target_bases.description: Remove the worst reads until only target_bases Mbp remain with Filtlong. If the input read set is less than 500 Mbp, this setting will have no effect.

plasme_download_db.description: Download plasme database. if false, plasme will not be downloaded and should be downloaded manually from https://zenodo.org/record/8046934/files/DB.zip?download=1

lineage_db.description: Lineage database for busco. See https://busco.ezlab.org/list_of_lineages.html for a list of available lineage databases.

raw.description: set to true if fastq file are separate in multiple fastq file

max_job_request_options.title: Max job request options
max_job_request_options.description: Set the top limit for requested resources for any single job.
max_job_request_options.help_text:
If you are running on a smaller system, a pipeline step requesting more resources than are available may cause the Nextflow to stop the run with an error. These options allow you to cap the maximum resources requested by any single job so that the pipeline will run on your system.

Note that you can not _increase_ the resources requested by any job using these options. For that you will need your own configuration file. See [the nf-core website](https://nf-co.re/usage/configuration) for details.

max_cpus.description: Maximum number of CPUs that can be requested for any single job.
max_cpus.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the CPU requirement for each process. Should be an integer e.g. `--max_cpus 1`

max_memory.description: Maximum memory that can be requested for any single job.
max_memory.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the memory requirement for each process. Should be a string e.g. `--max_memory '1GB'`
